text:
Desimartini Deodhar Trophy Final, Live cricket score, India B vs Tamil Nadu: TN 38/2 (10 ov) 
Dhawal Kulkarni has given India B a great start against Tamil Nadu, who are two wickets down, in the Deodhar Trophy final between India B and Tamil Nadu. Get live cricket score and live cricket updates of India B vs Tamil Nadu here. cricket Updated: Mar 29, 2017 09:58 IST HT Correspondent Hindustan Times Shikhar Dhawan will be crucial for India B in the Deodhar Trophy final against Tamil Nadu. Get live cricket score of Deodhar Trophy final between India B and Tamil Nadu here.(Hindustan Times) 
India B, unbeaten in the competition so far, start favourites against a tenacious Tamil Nadu team in the Deodhar Trophy final in Visakhapatnam on Wednesday. The Parthiv Patel-led India B have made great start in the title clash. Get live cricket score and live cricket updates of India B vs Tamil Nadu here. 
9:51 am :First, Kulkarni caught and bowled opener Gandhi (16) in the seventh over and then got No. 3 Murugan Ashwin (0) out in the ninth over. Ashwin was caught by Shikhar Dhawan. 
9:50 am :Dhawal Kulkarni affects mini collapse. Tamil Nadu reduced to 38/2 in 10 overs. 
9:40 am : Gandhi (10*) and Raju (4*) has started steadily. Tamil Nadu 17/0 in five overs. Dhawal Kulkarni and Ashok Dinda are bowling for India A, but are yet to get a wicket. 
9:30am: Action starts! Kaushik Gandhi and Ganga Sridhar Raju to open for Taml Nadu. 
9:00 am: Vijay Shankar-led Tamil Nadu have won the toss and will bat first 
8:55 am: Hello and welcome to the live coverage of India B vs Tamil Nadu here 
For the Vijay Hazare Trophy winners Tamil Nadu, the game will be about continuing their domestic form and avenging the defeat they suffered at the hands of India B here on Sunday. 
However, they bounced back in the following game against India A to make the final. The Indian cricket team selectors will be closely tracking the playersâ€™ performance tomorrow with the final being the last 50-over domestic game before the Champions Trophy in June. 
Though they have the whole of IPL to make a statement, the likes of Shikhar Dhawan, Dinesh Karthik and Manish Pandey would like to end the tournament on a high. 
Discarded India opener Dhawan has hit form with the scores of 128 and 50 in the previous two innings. Pandey, also playing for India B, attracted attention with a match-winning 104 against Tamil Nadu in the league phase. 
Tamil Nadu wicket-keeper batsman Dinesh Karthik too would like to be among the runs, having already scored a bagful in Ranji Trophy and Vijay Hazare Trophy where he ended as the leading scorer with 607 runs at an average of 86.71. 
The stylish batsman has made a case to be picked in the Indian team with M S Dhoni doing the keeping job. Among the bowlers, Mumbai pacer Dhawal Kulkarni has provided timely breakthroughs for India B, picking up three wickets in both the previous games. 
Left-arm spinner Sai Kishore has been the standout bowler for Tamil Nadu with seven scalps in two matches. India B have batted first on both occasions and ended up hammering 300 plus runs before defending them convincingly. tags
